intro: Anerincleistus angustifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leafed anerincleistus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
